# ðŸš€ Feature Request

Hello Prysm team :)

### Description

<!-- âœï¸ A clear and concise description of the problem or missing capability... --> 

Currently, Prysm processes the checking of validator roles without any parallelization (the `RolesAt` function).
https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/blob/f4681fde1946a86c5d33c389564241c7ca0e9c2f/validator/client/validator.go#L702-L704

This can cause delaying for performing validator roles such as attestation or block proposal, if single validator-client performing duties for many validators.

https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/blob/f4681fde1946a86c5d33c389564241c7ca0e9c2f/validator/client/runner.go#L145-L152

If this delay is severe, `getHeader` request to mev relay is also delayed, resulting the missed slots. Like below timeline. [ref](https://www.reddit.com/r/ethstaker/comments/136cz6j/comment/jir6uh8/?utm_source=share&utm_medium=web3x&utm_name=web3xcss&utm_term=1&utm_content=share_button)
```
1. t = 0 ms: New slot begins.
2. t > 2000 ms < 3000 ms: Validator makes getHeader call to all relays.
3. t > 3000 ms < 4000 ms: Validator's getHeader call to bloXroute times out after 950 ms, validator picks best bid from others, Aestus wins.
4. t = 4000 ms: Cutoff time, relay will no longer accept getPayload calls past this point.
5. t = 4401 ms: Blinded block is ready and signed, validator sends getPayload call to Aestus, Aestus receives it and rejects it as too late (past the cutoff).
6. t = 5368 ms: After 4 more retries, the validator mev-boost client gives up. As it has already signed one block, it doesn't want to risk a slashing by signing a second block, so resigns itself to missing the slot.
```

This issue is particularly noticeable in the following environments:
- A single validator-client is performing many validator duties
- web3signer is used instead of a local signer

Currently, within the `RolesAt` function, `isAggregator` is called by simple for looping for all validator public keys.
This function includes the process of `AGGREGATION_SLOT` signing internally, which seems to be the main bottleneck of the `RolesAt` function when using web3signer.

https://github.com/prysmaticlabs/prysm/blob/f4681fde1946a86c5d33c389564241c7ca0e9c2f/validator/client/validator.go#L777-L783


### Describe the solution you'd like

<!-- âœï¸ If you have a solution in mind, please describe it. --> 

One possible soultion is to use goroutines for each validator for paralleizing `RolesAt` function.
